TITLE: Docker Compose Configuration
DESCRIPTION: This snippet provides a docker-compose file for deploying Stash-box in a production environment. It includes configuration for the Stash-box service and optionally Traefik as a reverse proxy.  The full file is linked in the documentation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-box/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: YAML
CODE:
```
docker/production/docker-compose.yml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Stash-box with CLI options
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to run Stash-box locally on a specified host and port using command-line options. This allows users to configure the application's networking settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-box/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
stash-box --host 127.0.0.1 --port 80
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generate Typescript Types from GraphQL Schema
DESCRIPTION: This command generates Typescript types from the GraphQL schema. This is necessary after any updates to the GraphQL queries, mutations, or the schema itself to ensure type safety in the frontend application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-box/blob/master/frontend/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
pnpm generate
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Start Local Development Server with PNPM
DESCRIPTION: This command starts the local development server using PNPM. The server will typically start on port 3001 and provide hot reloading capabilities, automatically updating the browser whenever code changes are made.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-box/blob/master/frontend/README.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
pnpm start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Install Dependencies with PNPM
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the project dependencies using the PNPM package manager. It reads the package.json file and installs all listed dependencies into the node_modules directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-box/blob/master/frontend/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
pnpm i
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building Stash-box (Linux)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the command to build the Stash-box application on Linux after installing the necessary prerequisites (libvips and gcc). The command compiles the source code into an executable.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-box/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
make
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Build Release Bundle with PNPM
DESCRIPTION: This command builds the release bundle using PNPM. This creates an optimized and production-ready bundle of the frontend application, suitable for deployment to a web server.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-box/blob/master/frontend/README.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
pnpm build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating Self-Signed SSL Certificate with OpenSSL
DESCRIPTION: This command generates a self-signed SSL certificate and key using OpenSSL. It creates a 4096-bit RSA key, uses SHA256 hashing, sets the validity period to 7300 days, and configures subject alternative names (SANs) for the specified hostname and IP address. The resulting certificate and key are named stash-box.crt and stash-box.key, respectively. Requires OpenSSL to be installed on the system.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-box/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
openssl req -x509 -newkey rsa:4096 -sha256 -days 7300 -nodes -keyout stash-box.key -out stash-box.crt -extensions san -config <(echo "[req]"; echo distinguished_name=req; echo "[san]"; echo subjectAltName=DNS:stash-box.server,IP:127.0.0.1) -subj /CN=stash-box.server
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Copy Development Environment Configuration
DESCRIPTION: This command copies the shadow environment configuration file to a local development environment configuration file. This allows the developer to configure environment variables specific to their local development setup.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-box/blob/master/frontend/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cp .env.development.local.shadow .env.development.local
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Run Linter with PNPM
DESCRIPTION: This command runs the linter using PNPM. The linter analyzes the code for potential errors, style violations, and other issues to ensure code quality and consistency.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-box/blob/master/frontend/README.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
pnpm lint
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Run Code Formatter with PNPM
DESCRIPTION: This command runs the code formatter using PNPM. The code formatter automatically formats the code according to predefined style rules, ensuring consistent code formatting across the project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-box/blob/master/frontend/README.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
pnpm format
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Run Validation with PNPM
DESCRIPTION: This command runs the validation checks using PNPM. This typically includes running linters, formatters, and tests to ensure the code meets the project's quality standards before submitting a pull request.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-box/blob/master/frontend/README.md#_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
pnpm validate
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Database Extension Creation
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to create the necessary PostgreSQL extensions if the PostgreSQL user is not a superuser. These extensions are required for Stash-box to function correctly. It requires superuser privileges to execute.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-box/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: SQL
CODE:
```
CREATE EXTENSION pg_trgm; CREATE EXTENSION pgcrypto;
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Template Placeholders
DESCRIPTION: Defines placeholders within a template for injecting dynamic content. The placeholders include greeting, content, action URL and site name. The template engine likely uses these placeholders to replace them with actual values during runtime.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stashapp/stash-box/blob/master/pkg/user/templates/email.txt#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Go
CODE:
```
{{ .Greeting }}
```

LANGUAGE: Go
CODE:
```
{{ .Content }}
```

LANGUAGE: Go
CODE:
```
{{ .ActionURL }}
```

LANGUAGE: Go
CODE:
```
{{ .SiteName }}
```
